title: Sergio Ramos keen to represent Spain at 2020 Olympics after playing in European Championships
text:
Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos has revealed he's keen to represent Spain at the 2020 Olympics after playing in next summer's European Championships.

International sides are able to select three overage players in their squads, which are otherwise comprised of players under the age of 23.

As Spain's captain, Ramous would appear to be one of the most likely of La Roja's experienced players to be given a call-up - and he says he's open to the idea.

Sergio Ramos is keen to represent Spain at the 2020 Olympics if he is given a call-up

Ramos became Spain's most capped player of all time in Saturday's 1-1 draw with Norway

Ramos greeted former Real Madrid youngster Martin Odegaard after Saturday's game

'Any player that is offered the opportunity to play in the Olympic Games would say yes,' he said. 'It is too early to discuss this as I will not be rushed.

'For now, I am just focused on Real Madrid and qualifying for Euro 2020. There is still a long time left to decide, but it is a nice idea to go to the Olympics.'

Spain are on the verge of qualifying for Euro 2020 but saw their progress delayed after drawing 1-1 away at Norway in their Group F qualifier on Saturday.

Ramos is now Spain's most capped player of all-time after starting the fixture and looks set to add many more to his record if he features in both tournaments next summer.
description: Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos has revealed he's keen to represent Spain at the 2020 Olympics after playing in next summer's European Championships.
